name: GTD Sync with todo.txt

screenshots.caption: Customise icons for projects, next actions, actions due today and completed actions.
Change nodes into projects with the F6 key.
Change nodes into next actions with the F7 key.
Enter a context in the Where attribute.
Export your GTD mind map to todo.txt, open it in a todo.txt app, filter on context and check off completed actions
Sync changed and new next actions in todo.txt back to your GTD mind map

short_description:
The Freeplane add-on "GTD Sync with todo.txt" enables you to use the non-linear representation of Freeplane to organise and review your projects, next actions and delegated actions. You can then use a todo.txt list manager like Simpletask for Android to decide on the go what to do in a certain context and to check off completed tasks

The add-on imports new next or delegated actions and changes to existing next or delegated actions from the todo.txt file into the GTD mind map and then exports all next actions to the todo.txt file. In this way both files will stay synchronised.

In addition you need a cloud service like Dropbox to keep your todo.txt file in sync between systems.

For more information on Freeplane, see http://www.freeplane.org/wiki/index.php/Main_Page

The todo.txt format is a simple set of rules that makes todo.txt both human and machine-readable, see http://todotxt.com/.

The add-on is inspired by Freeplane|GTD, see http://auxilus.com/blog/freeplanegtd/
summary: The Freeplane add-on that syncs a GTD mind map with a todo.txt file
